critique: This document pertains to the administration and conservation of oil and gas bearing lands in naval petroleum reserves. It transfers the administration of these reserves to the Secretary of the Interior, subject to the President's supervision, but requires consultation with the Secretary of the Navy for any changes in drilling or land reservation policies. There is no direct indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, expansion of executive power, or impact on civil liberties. The document centralizes control at the federal level and involves government in economic regulation of resources. There's no clear indication regarding social inclusion.
